article.headline: Harvard 82, Dartmouth 56
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Pat Magnarelli scored 17 points as Harvard snapped a seven-game losing streak on Saturday with an 82-56 win over Dartmouth. Andrew Pusar added 16 points, seven rebounds and three assists for the Crimson (5-11, 1-0). Alex Barnett led the Big Green with 18 points and a team-high seven rebounds. John Ball had eight points, six rebounds and three assists for Dartmouth (5-8, 0-1), which lost its fourth straight. The Crimson led by nine, 31-22, before going on a 16-4 run to close out the first half for a 47-26 halftime lead. Harvard pulled ahead by as many as 32 points in the second half, 69-37, on Pusar's layup with 9:45 to play. Harvard had assists on 22 of its 29 baskets, led by Jeremy Lin with nine. The Crimson also outscored Dartmouth 44-26 in the paint and outrebounded the Big Green 41-29. Brad Unger had nine rebounds and eight points for Harvard. Michael Giovacchini added nine points for Dartmouth, which shot just 38 percent from the field to the Crimson's 52 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
